relation.text: August 1803 My Dear Sister , Will you never leave
July ; but , am by no means in the humour ffol for bearing unmerited Reproach . You know
never answered my last Letter , written three Months ago
believe I have done for six Years before
this Month , I know not what the consequence may be . We have had remarkably warm weather , and a dreadful Storm of Thunder & Lightening , which damaged
remain ever My Dear Sister Your faithful Friend & Brother Napier Hawick , Second August 1803
